work.name: NVIDIA
work.summary: Incorporated synthetic data for training lane detection model.
highlights: Developed data pipeline and experimented with ways to incorporate synthetic data to best target challenging scenarios in dangerous driving conditions
Resolved critical failure scenarios blocking PathNetV4 release and improved quantitative performance metrics
Developed tools to better visualize and identify challenging scenarios

work.name: NVIDIA
work.summary: Time series light signal detection for autonomous vehicles.
highlights: Detection of blinking light signals, eg. turn signal, brake signal, hazard lights, etc.
Laid groundwork by defining labelling guidelines, potential model architectures
Trained proof of concept classification network using public data

work.name: MIOVISION
work.summary: Traffic data analysis with computer vision.
highlights: Led project to introduce active learning techniques to data ingest pipeline
Optimized selection of images for labeling from large unlabelled pool via estimating model uncertainty (monte carlo dropout)
42% improvement in mean average precision between model trained on most uncertain images compared to the least

work.name: SYNAPSE TECHNOLOGY
work.summary: Developed and analyzed CNN models for detecting threats in security x-ray scans.
highlights: Developed fine grain rotational data augmentation method for object detection through automatic bounding box labelling on rotated images
Significantly improved model performance in underrepresented classes

work.name: PRAEMO
work.summary: Used LSTM to detect anomalies in time series vibration data and predict machine failure in industrial robots.

work.name: ESI
work.summary: Robotic navigation using reinforcement learning (Deep Q-learning) and IR sensors.
highlights: 95% success rate in simulation and 85% success rate on physical robot

publications.name: COVID-Net US-X: Enhanced Deep Neural Network for Detection of COVID-19 Patient Cases from Convex Ultrasound Imaging Through Extended Linear-Convex Ultrasound Augmentation Learning

projects.description: Text to speech model for fiction novels trained using automatically labeled audiobook dataset.
